alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 21 at 4:17PM PST until February 21 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...West winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Mono County and Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing dust may lead to areas of low visibility along US-95.
info.instruction: Now is the time to secure loose outdoor items such as patio furniture and trash cans before winds increase which could blow these items away. The best thing to do is prepare ahead of time by making sure you have extra food and water on hand, flashlights with spare batteries and/or candles in the event of a power outage.
